body_html: @markroxor from_numpy gives you a float64 because the input numpy array is float64. I was saying that your torch array is float32 which gets transformed to a float32 numpy array, but your numpy array is float64. There is no from_numpy here.
body_text: @markroxor from_numpy gives you a float64 because the input numpy array is float64. I was saying that your torch array is float32 which gets transformed to a float32 numpy array, but your numpy array is float64. There is no from_numpy here.
body: @markroxor `from_numpy` gives you a `float64` because the input numpy array is `float64`. I was saying that your torch array is `float32` which gets transformed to a `float32` numpy array, but your numpy array is `float64`. There is no `from_numpy` here.
